Message.Title: Yahoo! Completes Acquisition of Tumblr
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Inc. today announced it has completed its acquisition of Tumblr. Tumblr will be independently operated, and the product, service and brand will continue to be defined and developed separately by the Tumblr team. David Karp will remain CEO. “Tumblr is an incredible company. I’m thrilled to officially welcome David and his team to Yahoo!,” said Yahoo! CEO Marissa Mayer. On the deal completion, Tumblr CEO David Karp said, "We are beyond excited to partner with Marissa and the wonderful team at Yahoo! that we've already come to know well. Their support and belief in our vision gives us an opportunity now to be the most ambitious we've ever been."

Message.Title: Pay Attemtion Crisis equals Opportunity
Message.Msg: Look, If you were paying attention you should have anticipated this. I exited stocks earlier this week. Today I'm nibbling on growth stocks, FB and Yahoo. With cyclicals, commodities, banks and consumer discretionary taking steep dives, what I'm thinking is the first rebound will occur in growth stocks with solid stories behind them. FB and Yahoo fit that metric. And there will be a rebound, this QE easing isn't going to happen until end of year at earliest, if then, economic numbers are actually still improving. The market always overreacts to the Fed. If your thinking it through, and have prepared for it, this "crisis" is one heck of an opportunity for traders. Remember, it's your money, whether if's the Fed or your investments, pay attention.

Topic.Title: Likely YHOO current Q will be blockbuster

Message.Msg: This is my first calculation. Q1-FY13 -- Display=$402M, Search=$409, Other=$264. . My forecast with current Data: FY13 -- Display=$406.02 (assuming same FY12 YoY growth + new Sales model leveling) + Search=$433.66M (assuming YoY CPC growth + Growth of total searches per comscore) + Other=$244.20M (10% growth as past Q). . Total REV= $1,131M. Estimates=$1,100. My estimate is 3% higher.

Topic.Title: all obama needs is a 9000 pt drop from here to equal bush failure

Message.Msg: January 3rd, 2007 was the day that Barney Frank took over the House Financial Services Committee and Chris Dodd took over the Senate Banking Committee. The economic meltdown that happened 15 months later was in what part of the economy? BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES! THANK YOU DEMOCRATS (especially Barney ) for taking us from 13,000 DOW, 3.5 GDP and 4.6% Unemployment...to this CRISIS by (among MANY other things) dumping 5-6 TRILLION Dollars of toxic loans on the economy from YOUR Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac FIASCOES! (BTW: Bush asked Congress 17 TIMES to stop Fannie & Freddie -starting in 2001 because it was financially risky for the US economy). Barney blocked it and called it a "Chicken Little Philosophy" (and the sky did fall!) And who took the THIRD highest pay-off from Fannie Mae AND Freddie Mac? OBAMA And who fought against reform of Fannie and Freddie? OBAMA and the Democrat Congress, especially BARNEY !!!! So when someone tries to blame Bush... REMEMBER JANUARY 3rd, 2007.... THE DAY THE DEMOCRATS TOOK OVER!" Bush may have been in the car but the Democrats were in charge of the gas pedal and steering wheel they were driving the economy into the ditch. Budgets do not come from the White House.. They come from Congress and the party that controlled Congress since January 2007 is the Democratic Party. Furthermore, the Democrats controlled the budget process for 2008 & 2009 as well as 2010 & 2011. In that first year, they had to contend with George Bush, which caused them to compromise on spending, when Bush somewhat belatedly got tough on spending increases. For 2009 though, Nancy Pelosi & Harry Reid bypassed George Bush entirely, passing continuing resolutions to keep government running until Barack Obama could take office. At that time, they passed a massive omnibus spending bill to complete the 2009 budget . And where was Barack Obama during this time? He was a member of that very Congress that passed all of these massive spending bills, and he signed the omnibus bill as President to complete 2009. Let's remember what the deficits looked like during that period: If the Democrats inherited any deficit, it was the 2007 deficit, the last of the Republican budgets. That deficit was the lowest in five years, and the fourth straight decline in deficit spending. After that, Democrats in Congress took control of spending, and that includes Barack Obama, who voted for the budgets. If Obama inherited anything, he inherited it from himself .

Topic.Title: all obama needs is a 9000 pt drop from here to equal bush failure

Message.Msg: you need to consider the devaluation of the dollar then you would only have to down 4000 or less. The devaluation of the dollar has killed all of his supporters more than anyone, the fixed income, the union worker, the welfare have all seen their standard of living go down greatly under this president. He has no clue how to get the economy growing, 6 yrs and no growth under this man. This is the worst recovery in history. Then he lies daily and hides what he is doing, first the IRS and then the NSA are all his lap dogs and he lets our ambassador be killed with no retaliation. Truly sad days in the history of the USA. And I thought his treatment of our servicemen was bad but it doesn't hold a candle to these latest escapades. You democrats are so hard up to make a hero out of him that you close your eyes to the worst of crimes. I am a republican and I realize Bushes mistakes but you can't see anything with your messiah.

Message.Title: Yahoo email HACKED Sunday - check your recent sign-in activity
Message.Msg: Yahoo email hacked Sunday 16-June-2013. Expect further problems with Yahoo until they resolve and make public statement. Suggest checking your "Recent sign-in activity" within your account and changing your password. This is a nightmare for Yahoo.

Topic.Title: A new Spark is Comming

Message.Msg: Look at this new patent. granted to Yahoo to see how SPARK is going to get used: Advertisements displayed in a web page are enabled to be changed as a context of the web page changes without reloading the web page. A first set of one or more advertisements may be displayed on a web page. One or more of the displayed advertisements may be replaced with one or more alternative advertisements.

Message.Title: Alibaba is the biggest B2B in the World
Message.Msg: They have 100m accounts and in only one day sold $47.3m! GUESS Yahoo will have a huge "other" revenue.

Topic.Title: Alibaba is the biggest B2B in the World

Message.Msg: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd said on Thursday that it has attracted over 100 million business-to-business customers, making the e-commerce giant the world's top B2B online service provider.

Message.Title: Yahoo's Mayer shines spotlight on video
Message.Msg: Yahoo is currently bidding to acquire Hulu, the online hub for TV programming owned by Walt Disney Co and News Corp , sources with knowledge of the situation have told Reuters. "We're working on various methods in terms of how we can increase our video views, and watching," Mayer said at the Reuters Global Technology Summit on Thursday. "It's clear to me that our video business is something that's growing a lot. It's something that we'd like to accelerate." Mayer would not comment on the bid for Hulu.
